identified-content.person: BAFFORD, MARGARET ANGELINE BRAND (MARGARET ANGELINE BRAND GRACE)

block.p: Margaret Angeline Brand Bafford and William Edward Grace were married yesterday by the Rev. Susannah R. Smith at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York.
Mrs. Grace, 28, is known as Angeline. She was an interior designer at Cullman & Kravis, a New York design firm, until April. She graduated from Denison University.
Margaret Angeline Brand Bafford and William Edward Grace were married yesterday by the Rev. Susannah R. Smith at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York.
Mrs. Grace, 28, is known as Angeline. She was an interior designer at Cullman & Kravis, a New York design firm, until April. She graduated from Denison University.
She is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Edmonds Bafford of New York. Her father retired as a director of institutional sales at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York.

The bridegroom, 28, is known as Ted. He is an associate in San Francisco in the Internet and software group of Chase H & Q, an investment banking division of Chase Manhattan. He graduated from Bucknell University.

Mr. Grace, who changed his surname, is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Rosenthal of New Canaan, Conn. His mother, Sheila Rosenthal, is a real estate agent in New Canaan at Country Living Associates. His father, who owns Asian Asset Associates, a management consulting business in New Canaan, retired as a director of I.B.M.'s large computer systems division for the Asia-Pacific region in Tokyo.
